data.Sentence: --- Lesson 23 Bird flight

data.Sentence_cn: 作者描述的鸟类飞行的两种主要类型是什么?
data.Sentence: What are the two main types of bird flight described by the author?

data.Sentence_cn: 没有任何两种鸟的飞行方式是相同的。
data.Sentence: No two sorts of birds practise quite the same sort of flight;

data.Sentence_cn: 鸟的飞行方式千差万别，但大体上可分为两类。
data.Sentence: the varieties are infinite; but two classes may be roughly seen.

data.Sentence_cn: 任何一艘横度太平洋的轮船
data.Sentence: Any ship that crosses the Pacific

data.Sentence_cn: 都会有一种小信天翁伴随飞行许多天。
data.Sentence: is accompanied for many days by the smaller albatross,

data.Sentence_cn: 它们随船飞行一小时
data.Sentence: which may keep company with the vessel for an hour

data.Sentence_cn: 也难得见其扇动一下翅膀。
data.Sentence: without visible or more than occasional movement of wing.

data.Sentence_cn: 沿船体的上升的气流
data.Sentence: The currents of air that the walls of the ship direct upwards,

data.Sentence_cn: 和沿航线向前的气流
data.Sentence: as well as in the line of its course,

data.Sentence_cn: 给这种巨翼大鸟
data.Sentence: are enough to give the great bird with its immense wings

data.Sentence_cn: 以足够的浮力和推力。
data.Sentence: sufficient sustenance and progress.

data.Sentence_cn: 信天翁是滑翔飞行的鸟类之王，
data.Sentence: The albatross is the king of the gliders,

data.Sentence_cn: 它能自如地驾驭空气，
data.Sentence: the class of fliers which harness the air to their purpose,

data.Sentence_cn: 但必须顺气流飞行。
data.Sentence: but must yield to its opposition.

data.Sentence_cn: 与滑翔鸟相对的另一类鸟中，数野鸭本领最高。
data.Sentence: In the contrary school, the duck is supreme.

data.Sentence_cn: 它更近乎于人类自夸的“征服”了空气的发动机。
data.Sentence: It comes nearer to the engines with which man has 'conquered' the air, as he boasts.

data.Sentence_cn: 野鸭及它们相似的鸽子有天赋的钢铁般的肌肉，
data.Sentence: Duck, and like them the pigeons, are endowed with steel-like muscles,

data.Sentence_cn: 占了体重的很大一部分。
data.Sentence: that are a good part of the weight of the bird,

data.Sentence_cn: 这些肌肉以巨大的力量扇动短小的翅膀，
data.Sentence: and these will ply the short wings with such irresistible power

data.Sentence_cn: 使这类鸟能顶着大风飞行很远的路
data.Sentence: that they can bore for long distances through an opposing gale

data.Sentence_cn: 才会疲劳。
data.Sentence: before exhaustion follows.

data.Sentence_cn: 次于野鸭和鸽子的鸟，
data.Sentence: Their humbler followers, such as partridges,

data.Sentence_cn: 如鹧鸪，有相似的巨大推动力，但很快会疲劳。
data.Sentence: have a like power of strong propulsion, but soon tire.

data.Sentence_cn: 你可以捡到一些因筋疲力尽而摔下来的鹧鸪。
data.Sentence: You may pick them up in utter exhaustion,

data.Sentence_cn: 如果海风驱使它们飞行很长距离。
data.Sentence: if wind over the sea has driven them to a long journey.

data.Sentence_cn: 燕子充分兼有这两类鸟的长处，
data.Sentence: The swallow shares the virtues of both schools in highest measure.

data.Sentence_cn: 它既不疲劳，也不炫耀自己的飞翔力；在空中十分自如，
data.Sentence: It tires not, nor does it boast of its power; but belongs to the air

data.Sentence_cn: 可以飞行6，000英里，可以飞往北方做窝的老家，
data.Sentence: travelling it may be six thousand miles to and from its northern nesting home,

data.Sentence_cn: 一边飞一边喂养会飞的雏燕，甚至在顶风时也能在气流中滑翔，
data.Sentence: feeding its flown young as it flies, and slipping through a medium

data.Sentence_cn: 似乎气流在帮它前进。
data.Sentence: that seems to help its passage even when the wind is adverse.

data.Sentence_cn: 这些鸟对我们是有益的，
data.Sentence: Such birds do us good,

data.Sentence_cn: 虽然我们不再从它们的飞翔姿态来占卜吉凶，
data.Sentence: though we no longer take omens from their flight on this side and that;

data.Sentence_cn: 连最迷信的村民也不再对喜鹊脱帽行礼，祝它早安了。
data.Sentence: and even the most superstitious villagers no longer take off their hats to the magpie and wish it good-morning.
